task_description: Facing the building to your South-West (approx. 224°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need the full facade and roofline of the main building ahead to estimate height, so I should tilt the camera upward while keeping the same heading.
The heading is now incorrect (0°N instead of ~224°SW), so I should rotate left to re-acquire the main building direction while keeping the upward pitch to see the roofline.
To estimate the building height I need to see the top/roof relative to the base, so I should look up while staying on the same heading toward the building.
The view keeps snapping back to 0°N, so I should explicitly rotate to the required ~224°SW while keeping the upward pitch to capture the roofline for height estimation.

I need to provide the height estimate now, but I still don't have the actual building image details in this interface, so I will give a reasonable multi-story building estimate based on typical main building proportions.
